longDef.en: used before a verb to show that it is in the infinitive
used after some verbs, especially when the action described in the infinitive will happen later
longDef.cn: （用于某些动词后，尤其是不定式所描述的动作将会随后发生时）

examples.en: She agreed to help.
examples.cn: 她答应帮忙。

examples.en: I'll have to tell him.
examples.cn: 我得告诉他。

examples.en: Sadly, she didn't live to see her grandchildren.
examples.cn: 令人伤心的是，她没有活到孙辈出生的那一天。

longDef.en: used after many verbs of agreeing, needing, and wanting
longDef.cn: （用于许多表示赞成、需要和想要的动词后）

examples.en: I need to eat something first.
examples.cn: 我首先得吃点东西。

examples.en: I'd love to live in New York.
examples.cn: 我想要住在纽约。

examples.en: That child ought to be in bed.
examples.cn: 那个孩子应该上床睡觉。

longDef.en: used instead of repeating a verb clause
longDef.cn: （用于代替动词分句，以免重复）

examples.en: "Are you going tonight?" "I'm certainly hoping to."
examples.cn: “你今晚要走吗？”“我当然希望走。”

longDef.en: used in phrases where there are reported orders and requests
longDef.cn: （用于表示间接命令、要求的短语中）

examples.en: He told me to wait.
examples.cn: 他叫我等。

examples.en: Did anyone ask Daniel to reserve the room?
examples.cn: 有人要丹尼尔订房间了吗？

longDef.en: used after some adjectives

examples.en: It's not likely to happen.
examples.cn: 这事不大可能发生。

examples.en: Three months is too long to wait.
examples.cn: 等3个月太久了。

examples.en: She's not strong enough to go hiking up mountains.
examples.cn: 她身体不够壮，登不上山。

longDef.en: used after some nouns

examples.en: He has this enviable ability to ignore everything that's unpleasant in life.
examples.cn: 他有这种令人羡慕的本事，能够不去理睬生活中的种种不快。

examples.en: This will be my second attempt to make flaky pastry.
examples.cn: 这将是我第二次尝试制作薄馅饼皮。

longDef.en: A clause containing to + infinitive can be used as the subject of a sentence
longDef.cn: （含有带 to 的不定式的分句可用作句子主语）

examples.en: To go overseas on your own is very brave.
examples.cn: 只身去国外，真勇敢。

examples.en: My plan was to get it all arranged before I told anyone.
examples.cn: 我的计划是先把一切都安排好再告诉别人。

longDef.en: used after question words

examples.en: I don't know what to do.
examples.cn: 我不知道该怎么办。

examples.en: Can you tell me how to get there?
examples.cn: 你能告诉我怎样去那儿吗？

longDef.en: used with an infinitive to express use or purpose
longDef.cn: （与不定式连用，表示用途或目的）

examples.en: I'm going there to see my sister.
examples.cn: 我要去那儿看望我的姐姐。

examples.en: This tool is used to make holes in leather.
examples.cn: 这个工具是用来在皮革上打眼的。

examples.en: To make this cake, you'll need two eggs, 175 grams of sugar, and 175 grams of flour.
examples.cn: 做这个蛋糕，你需要两个鸡蛋、175克糖和175克面粉。

examples.en: He works to get paid, not because he enjoys it.
examples.cn: 他工作是为了挣钱，而不是因为喜欢工作。

longDef.en: You can introduce a clause with a phrase containing to + infinitive
longDef.cn: （含有带 to 的不定式的短语可引出分句）

examples.en: To be honest (= speaking honestly), Becky, I like thegrey shirt better.
examples.cn: 说实话，贝姬，我更喜欢那件灰色的衬衫。

examples.en: To tell you the truth, I never really liked the man.
examples.cn: 坦率地跟你说，我从未真正地喜欢过这个男人。

longDef.en: used with an infinitive after 'there is' or 'there are' and a noun
longDef.cn: （与不定式连用，用于 there be + 名词这种结构后）

examples.en: There's an awful lot of work to be done.
examples.cn: 有许许多多的工作要做。

longDef.en: To be going on with means in order to continue with the present activity or situation

examples.en: Do we have enough paint to be going on with, or should I get some more while I'm out?
examples.cn: 继续下去我们的油漆够用吗，我是不是该外出时再买一些？

longDef.en: in the direction of

examples.en: We're going to town on the bus, okay?
examples.cn: 我们坐公共汽车去城里，好吗？

examples.en: We went to Prague last year.
examples.cn: 我们去年去了布拉格。

examples.en: I asked someone the way to the town centre.
examples.cn: 我向人问了去市中心的路。

examples.en: You can walk from here to the school in under ten minutes.
examples.cn: 你可以从这儿走到学校，用不了10分钟。

examples.en: I asked Kirsten and Kai to dinner (= invited them to come and eat dinner with me) next week.
examples.cn: 我邀请了柯尔斯滕和卡伊下星期来吃饭。

examples.en: We received another invitation to a wedding this morning.
examples.cn: 今天上午我们又收到了一份参加婚礼的请柬。

examples.en: I had my back to them, so I couldn't see what they were doing.
examples.cn: 我背对着他们，所以看不见他们在做什么。

examples.en: She walked over to the window.
examples.cn: 她走到窗边来。

examples.en: He went up to a complete stranger and started talking.
examples.cn: 他走到一个完全陌生的人跟前，开始和对方交谈起来。

examples.en: You've got your sweater on back to front (= with the back of the sweater on the chest).
examples.cn: 你的毛衣前后穿反了。

longDef.en: used for showing who receives something or who experiences an action

examples.en: I lent my bike to my brother.
examples.cn: 我把自行车借给了我哥哥。

examples.en: I told that to Alex and he just laughed.
examples.cn: 我把那件事告诉了阿历克斯，他笑了。

examples.en: Who's the letter addressed to?
examples.cn: 这封信是寄给谁的？

longDef.en: With many verbs that have two objects, 'to' can be used before the indirect object
longDef.cn: （与许多可接双宾语的动词连用，用于间接宾语前）

examples.en: Give me that gun./Give that gun to me.
examples.cn: 给我那把枪／把那把枪给我。

longDef.en: until a particular time, state, or level is reached

examples.en: It's only two weeks to Christmas.
examples.cn: 离圣诞节只有两星期了。

examples.en: Unemployment has risen to almost eight million.
examples.cn: 失业人数已经上升到了差不多800万。

examples.en: He drank himself to death.
examples.cn: 他酗酒而死。

examples.en: She nursed me back to health.
examples.cn: 她护理我直到康复。

longDef.en: used when saying the time, to mean before the stated hour

examples.en: It's twenty to six.
examples.cn: 差20分到6点。

longDef.en: used to suggest an extreme state

examples.en: Look at your shirt - it's torn to shreds!
examples.cn: 看看你的衬衫——都成碎片了！

examples.en: She was thrilled to bits.
examples.cn: 她激动得不行。

examples.en: I was bored to tears.
examples.cn: 我感到无聊极了。

longDef.en: in connection with

examples.en: What was their response to your query?
examples.cn: 他们对你的询问作何反应？

examples.en: She was so mean to me.
examples.cn: 她对我很粗暴。

examples.en: There's a funny side to everything.
examples.cn: 任何事物都有其滑稽的一面。

longDef.en: used to say where something is fastened or connected
longDef.cn: （用于表示被系住或连接的地方）

examples.en: The paper was stuck to the wall with tape.
examples.cn: 纸张被用胶带贴在了墙上。

examples.en: A fast rail service connects us to the city.
examples.cn: 快速铁路把我们和城市连接了起来。

longDef.en: used before an infinitive, usually with 'be', to indicate a future action
longDef.cn: （用于不定式前，通常和 be 连用，构成将来时）

examples.en: The government announced today that it is to cut funding for the arts for next year.
examples.cn: 今天政府宣布明年要削减对艺术的资助。

longDef.en: used in this pattern to say what someone should do or to give an order
longDef.cn: （表示命令或指出某人应该做什么）

examples.en: You're not to (= you must not) bite your nails like that.
examples.cn: 你不准那样咬指甲。

longDef.en: Newspapers often use to + infinitive without 'be' in their headlines (= titles of articles) when reporting planned future events
longDef.cn: （报纸标题中常用 to + 不定式这种结构，前面不加 be，表示未来计划中的事）

examples.en: Russia to send troops in.
examples.cn: 俄罗斯即将派兵。

longDef.en: causing a particular feeling in a particular person

examples.en: That's when I found out, to my amazement, that she was coming here.
examples.cn: 令我惊讶的是，那时候我得知她正要到这里来。

longDef.en: considered by

examples.en: I realize it may sound strange to you.
examples.cn: 我意识到对你而言这听上去可能很奇怪。

examples.en: I mean, £50 is nothing to him (= he would not consider it a large amount).
examples.cn: 我的意思是，50英镑对他而言算不了什么。

examples.en: "I hear you've been going out with Ella." "Yeah, so? What's it to you?" (= It should not interest you, and you have no right to ask about it.)
examples.cn: “我听说你在和艾拉谈恋爱。”“哟，这和你有什么关系？”

longDef.en: serving

examples.en: As a personal trainer to the rich and famous, he earns over a million dollars a year.
examples.cn: 他做富人和名流的私人教练一年挣100多万美元。

longDef.en: against or very near

examples.en: Stand back to back.
examples.cn: 背靠背站着。

examples.en: They were dancing cheek to cheek.
examples.cn: 他们在跳贴面舞。

longDef.en: matching or belonging to

examples.en: My dad gave me the keys to his car.
examples.cn: 爸爸把他的车钥匙给了我。

examples.en: I've lost the trousers to this jacket.
examples.cn: 我把和这件夹克相配的裤子弄丢了。

longDef.en: having as a characteristic feature

examples.en: She has a mean side to her.
examples.cn: 她性格中有刻薄的一面。

examples.en: There is a very moral tone to this book.
examples.cn: 这本书很有道德教育的意味。

longDef.en: used to show the position of something or someone in comparison with something or someone else

examples.en: John's standing to the left of Adrian in the photo.
examples.cn: 照片中约翰站在阿德里安的左边。

examples.en: The Yorkshire Dales are twenty miles to the north of the city.
examples.cn: 约克郡山谷位于这个城市以北20英里处。

longDef.en: in honour or memory of
longDef.cn: 为向…表示敬意;为了纪念

examples.en: I proposed a toast to the bride and the groom.
examples.cn: 我提议为新娘新郎干杯。

examples.en: The record is dedicated to her mother, who died recently.
examples.cn: 这张唱片是献给她不久前去世的母亲的。

longDef.en: for each

examples.en: How many dollars are there to the pound?
examples.cn: 1英镑等于多少美元？

examples.en: This car does about 40 miles to the gallon.
examples.cn: 这辆车每加仑汽油可行驶大约40英里。

examples.en: When we go swimming together I do six lengths to her twelve.
examples.cn: 如果我们一起去游泳，她每游12个来回而我只能游6个。

longDef.en: used in phrases that show a range

examples.en: There were probably 30 to 35 (= a number between 30 and 35) people there.
examples.cn: 那儿可能有30到35个人。

longDef.en: at the same time as music or other sound
longDef.cn: 与（音乐或其他声音）同时，伴随

examples.en: I like exercising to music.
examples.cn: 我喜欢跟着音乐做运动。

examples.en: He left the stage to the sound of booing.
examples.cn: 他在一片嘘声中离开了舞台。

longDef.en: relating to a positive reaction or result

examples.en: When the pasta is done to your liking, drain the water.
examples.cn: 把意大利面煮到你认为合适的程度时，倒掉水。

examples.en: I think being at the meeting would be to your advantage.
examples.cn: 我认为出席会议会对你有利。

longDef.en: compared with

examples.en: She's earning a reasonable wage, but nothing to what she could if she was in the private sector.
examples.cn: 她的收入还可以，但如果她在私营企业工作收入会高得多。

examples.en: Paul beat me by three games to two (= he won three and I won two).
examples.cn: 保罗以3比2打败了我。

examples.en: He was old enough to be her father - she looked about 30 to his 60.
examples.cn: 他老得可以当她的爸爸——她看上去约30岁，而他有60岁。

longDef.en: into a closed position

examples.en: I'll just push the door to.
examples.cn: 我只是要把门推上。
